content.raw:
This branch no longer compiles for me:

```
building/libgazebo_gui_building.so.4.1.0: undefined reference to `gazebo::gui::RectItem::SetHighlighted(bool)'
building/libgazebo_gui_building.so.4.1.0: undefined reference to `gazebo::gui::EditorItem::SetHighlighted(bool)'
building/libgazebo_gui_building.so.4.1.0: undefined reference to `gazebo::gui::WallSegmentItem::SetHighlighted(bool)'
```

Maybe a bad merge from default?

content.raw:
Small bug: If you make at least 3 floors, each with staircases, and delete a lower level (e.g. the first one), then the staircases on higher levels will become opaque, even though the walls and floors remain invisible.

Looks like this bug is not fixed by [PR 1316](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/1316/building-editor-detach-all-child-manip).
content.html:
Small bug: If you make at least 3 floors, each with staircases, and delete a lower level (e.g. the first one), then the staircases on higher levels will become opaque, even though the walls and floors remain invisible.

Looks like this bug is not fixed by PR 1316.

content.raw:
Interesting that the walls are influencing the floor like this. Unfortunately your change leaves all walls looking selected when a new level is added (orange color, measure and grabbers visible). 
![transp1.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/60443254-transp1.png)
content.html: Interesting that the walls are influencing the floor like this. Unfortunately your change leaves all walls looking selected when a new level is added (orange color, measure and grabbers visible).

pull_request.title: Change level opacity based on current building level

pullrequest.title: Change level opacity based on current building level

content.html:
Alright, I think the floor issue is due to lines 980-981 in EditorView.cc, function OnAddLevel.

    // Select -> deselect to trigger change
    wallSegmentItem->setSelected(true);
    wallSegmentItem->setSelected(false);

I changed these lines to wallSegmentItem->Set3dTransparency(0.4); and it appeared to fix the problem. The changes are in branch buildingedit_change_level_transparency_louise_jackie.

pull_request.title: Change level opacity based on current building level

pullrequest.title: Change level opacity based on current building level

content.raw:
I noticed that when a level is deleted, the levels above weren't being updated correctly.

Fixed that and made some other changes on [ buildingedit_change_level_transparency_louise](#!/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/buildingedit_change_level_transparency_louise..default), feel free to merge if you agree. Some of the other changes are:

1. Addressed my previous comments

2. Merged with default and resolved conflicts

3. Moved all functionality from `BuildingItem` to `EditorItem`, so I can do `4.`:

4. Notify manip when an item has moved to another level (i.e. level below deleted)

I found only one issue left. When adding levels, the new level's floor is transparent for like a second, but soon becomes opaque - I have no idea where the command to become opaque is coming from. However, when the floor's color is changed or the levels are changed, its transparency behaves properly... Floor mysteries :/
content.html:
I noticed that when a level is deleted, the levels above weren't being updated correctly.

Fixed that and made some other changes on buildingedit_change_level_transparency_louise, feel free to merge if you agree. Some of the other changes are:

  1. Addressed my previous comments

  2. Merged with default and resolved conflicts

  3. Moved all functionality from BuildingItem to EditorItem, so I can do 4.:

  4. Notify manip when an item has moved to another level (i.e. level below deleted)

I found only one issue left. When adding levels, the new level's floor is transparent for like a second, but soon becomes opaque - I have no idea where the command to become opaque is coming from. However, when the floor's color is changed or the levels are changed, its transparency behaves properly... Floor mysteries :/
